title: 112_s1269
content: The "High School Data Transparency Act of 2011" requires disclosure of statistics on equality in athletic programs under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. The Secretary must annually collect data from coeducational secondary schools with interscholastic athletic programs that receive Federal financial assistance. This includes information on the total number of male and female students, team listings with participant demographics and expenditures. The Secretary collects annual data from coeducational secondary schools with athletic programs receiving Federal financial assistance, including details on team expenditures such as travel, equipment, uniforms, facilities, and medical personnel. The Secretary collects annual data on team expenditures for coeducational secondary schools with athletic programs, including details on employment status and duties of personnel, expenditures for publicity, and the total number of coaches with their gender and employment status specified. The Secretary collects annual data on team expenditures for coeducational secondary schools with athletic programs, including details on employment status and duties of personnel, expenditures for publicity, and the total number of coaches with their gender and employment status specified. Coeducational secondary schools must disclose information on the total number of competitive events scheduled, participation in postseason competition, and the success of the team in postseason events to students and the public upon request. Each coeducational secondary school must provide annual reports to the Secretary containing detailed information on team expenditures, personnel employment status, publicity expenses, and coach demographics. The Secretary is responsible for posting these reports on the Department of Education's website within 15 days of availability and notifying all secondary schools about the information's accessibility within 180 days of the High School Data Transparency Act of 2011 enactment. The Secretary must issue guidance to schools on collecting and reporting required information under subsection (b).
